result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan D. Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan D. Miller was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Doug Henderson.  Victim present; victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 18mos.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Bond to be applied towards advocate counsel fees.  If there is a balance of atty fees - shall be paid at the rate of $25/month until paid in full.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Doug Henderson.  Atty Henderson requests an adjournment; recently appointed and has not met w/his client.  FPT adj to 10/15/15 @ 10:30am, JS 11/2/15 @ 9am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft wishes to have counsel appointed by the court; he reports he was turned down by the PD's office since he was working two jobs.  JS date removed from the court's calendar.  FP set for 7/16/15 @ 3pm.  Deft instructed to report to the PD's office to re-apply for their services now that is he working only (1) job.  Deft also instructed to bring his tax return and most recent paystub to the next hrg.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

223pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: LE  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.
